abstract.text: A description of the format of per-vertex data for a single vertex attribute in a mesh object.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object store vertex attributes—such as vertex position, surface normal vector, or texture coordinates—that define its 3D shape and other data for use in rendering. Attribute information describes the structure and layout of that data. A collection of vertex attribute objects and additional information forms a
object, which completely describes the layout of vertex buffers for a mesh.

abstract.text: Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.
A container for vertex buffer data to be used in rendering a 3D object.
The array of buffers that provide vertex data for the mesh.
The general interface for managing storage of vertex and index data used in loading, processing, and rendering meshes.
The general interface for managing allocation of data buffers to be used in loading, processing, and rendering meshes.
A memory buffer that stores vertex or index data for a Model I/O mesh.
A basic allocator implementation that allocates from main memory using data objects.
An object that manages access to a memory buffer used for the data storage of a Model I/O mesh.
The general interface for logical pools of memory used in allocation of related mesh data buffers.
A standard implementation of the
protocol.
A description of the format of per-vertex data for a single vertex attribute in a mesh object.
The index of the vertex buffer containing data for this attribute in a mesh’s
array.
The format of per-vertex data for the attribute.
Initializes a vertex attribute object with the specified property values.
The default value for vertex data for this attribute.
An identifier for the semantic use of the vertex attribute.
The offset, in bytes, of vertex data for the attribute in a vertex buffer, relative to the start of data for each vertex.
An object that provides convenience access to vertex data for a specific vertex attribute of a mesh.
A
object describes layout information for a vertex buffer in a
object. A collection of vertex layer objects, vertex attribute objects, and additional information forms a
object, which completely describes the layout of vertex buffers for a mesh.
A description of the structure, format, and layout for vertex data buffers associated with a mesh.
Descriptions of the data size and layout for a vertex attribute, used by the
property.
Names that identify semantic uses for vertex attribute data, used by the
property.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
